Questions.question: What do you know about data structures?

answers.a: Not sure about data structures, I don't know the difference between Arrays and LinkedLists
answers.b: I am able to explain to others about LinkedList,Arrays,Hash tables and use cases
answers.c: I can explain basic data structures along with space and time complexities, plus explain how hash tables are implemented along with how collisions work and priority queues
answers.d: I am kwowledgable of advanced data structures such as B-trees, binomial heaps, AVL trees, Skip lists,etc

Questions.question: What do you know about Algorithms?

answers.a: Not sure about algorithms, I would struggle to find the average value in an array
answers.b: I know basic sorting, searching, data strucutre traversal and retrival algorithms
answers.c: I can explain trees, Graphs, simple greedy and divide and conquer algorithms
answers.d: I am able to recognize and code dynamic programming solutions, good knowledge of graph algorithms, good knowledge of numerical computation algorithms, able to identify NP problems,etc

Questions.question: What do you know about System programming

answers.a: Not sure what what a compiler, linker or interpreter is
answers.b: I have basic understanding of compilers, linker and interpreters, and understand what assembly code is and how things work at the hardware level. Some knowledge of virtual memory and paging
answers.c: I understand kernel mode vs. user mode, multi-threading, synchronization primitives and how they're implemented, able to read assembly code. Understands how networks work, understanding of network protocols and socket level programming.
answers.d: I understand the entire programming stack, hardware (CPU + Memory + Cache + Interrupts + microcode), binary code, assembly, static and dynamic linking, compilation, interpretation, JIT compilation, garbage collection, heap, stack, memory addressing.

Questions.question: How many languages do you have professional experience with?

answers.b: Imperative, Object-Oriented and declarative (SQL), added bonus if they understand static vs dynamic typing, weak vs strong typing and static inferred types
answers.c: Functional, added bonus if they understand lazy evaluation, currying, continuations
